str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Newly begotten, newly born. From arti and gennetos; just born, i.e. a young convert.
Infant, babe, child in arms. Of uncertain affinity; an infant literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From epi and potheo; to dote upon, i.e. Intensely crave possession.
Unadulterated, pure, guileless. Undeceitful, i.e. unadulterated.
(a) reasonable, rational, (b) metaphorical, as contrasted with the literal. From logos; rational.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I cause to increase, become greater (b) I increase, grow. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to grow, i.e. Enlarge.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Feminine of a derivative of soter as noun; rescue or safety.
